dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2593 IH: Making Any Reimbursement Against the Law for Guarding Overnight Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Cohen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit the President from personally profiting from Secret Service protection.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Making Any Reimbursement Against the Law for Guarding Overnight Act or the MARALAGO Act.

section.header: Limitation on use of funds by United States Secret Service

subsection.text: No Federal funds may be used by the Director of the United States Secret Service to purchase, rent, lease, or otherwise procure from a President or any entity owned or controlled by a President, or to reimburse a President or any entity owned or controlled by a President for, lodging, meals, office space, or any other expense incurred by the United States Secret Service during the course of protecting a President at the President’s residence.

Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a President or an entity owned or controlled by a President, may gift to the United States Secret Service lodging, meals, office space, or any other expense incurred by the United States Secret Service during the course of protecting a President at the President or former President’s residence.
In this section, the term President includes a former President.
